meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I knew the answer to the question.
meanings.sent2: She knew the song lyrics by heart.
meanings.sent3: The cat knew it was time for dinner when it heard the can opener.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, he knew his journey was coming to an end.
meanings.sent5: The detective knew the culprit's identity all along.

meanings.definition: To be aware of through observation, inquiry, or information.
meanings.sent1: I knew the weather would change because of the dark clouds.
meanings.sent2: They knew about the surprise party before it happened.
meanings.sent3: The teacher knew the students were up to something when they whispered and giggled.
meanings.sent4: She knew the truth would eventually come out, so she confessed.
meanings.sent5: The scientist knew the experiment would succeed after months of research.
